comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Flight-Commander Joseph Ruscombe Wadham Smyth-Pigott (note spelling, caption on photo is correct) of the Royal Naval Air Service, was awarded the Disdinguished Service Order in November 1915, see www.flightglobal.com/pdfarchive/view/1915/1915%20-%200970... (end of page) "November 13 (1915) – Flying a BE.2c, Royal Naval Air Service Flight Commander J. R. W. Smyth-Pigott makes a daring night bombing attack on a bridge of the Berlin-Constantinople railway over the Maritsa River at Kuleli Burgas in the Ottoman Empire from an altitude of 300 feet (91 meters). Although the bridge survives, he receives the Distinguished Service Order for gallantry." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1915_in_aviation#November See also www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29381/pages/11756/page.pdf Date of birth: August 9, 1890 (discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/details/D81235...) He died on October 8, 1971 (www.thepeerage.com/p7609.htm#i76084)

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you so much, B-59, for your excellent and well documented research. We'll add some of this information to the record the next time we update.

comment.author: 109026833@N05
comment._content: JRW Smyth Pigott was my great grandmother's younger brother. He is mentioned many times in a book she wrote ("Four Score Years and Ten") that I will be publishing later this year on Amazon.
